topic.title: Failover a node
topic.shortdesc: To failover a node means that Couchbase Server removes a node from a cluster and makes replicated data at other nodes available for client requests.

note.p:
To failover a node in a Couchbase cluster, an administrator must have one of these roles:
Full administrator
Cluster administrator To learn about administrative roles in Couchbase, see .

body.p: There are three types of failovers: graceful, hard, and automatic failover.
